oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Athletic Association, Hume-Fogg Yearbook, "The Echo" Nashville, Tennessee, 1925
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Athletic Committee, pictured in the 1925 yearbook of Hume-Fogg High School. Left to right: Mercedes Richter (Sec. & Treas. Spring Term); Maxine Richter (Sec. & Treas. Fall Term); Charles Currin (President, Spring Term); Prof. C.T. Kirkpatrick (Faculty Member); Jesse Ragan (President, Fall Term); and, Capt. A.J. Powell (Faculty Member). The Hume-Fogg High School is a public high school located at 700 Broadway in Nashville, Tennessee. In 1912 Hume High School and Fogg High School merged into Hume-Fogg at the school's current site on Broadway. The building was constructed in the Tudor Revival style by architects William B. Ittner and Robert Sharp. In 1942 Hume-Fogg was recast as a Technical and Vocational School. In 1982 it was restructured to serve as an academic magnet school for Nashville's gifted and talented students. Hume-Fogg was added to the National Registry of Historic Places in 1974. Forms part of the Hume-Fogg High School Yearbook Collection. 1 yearbook.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Richter, Mercedes; Richter, Maxine; Currin, Charles; Kirkpatrick, C.T.; Ragan, Jesse; Powell, A.J.
